inn1.comm: appeal first ball! But the umpire is unmoved, or rather he does move but walks away from his position which means he is not interested. Inswinger to start off and it cuts Tamim in half. Jerks back off a good length and thuds into his back thigh, Too high and might have drifted down leg
good length ball on middle and leg, keeps it down
shortish on middle and leg, Tamim works it away towards fine leg
pushed back at the bowler as Chatara continues bowling full and moving the ball back in at the left-hander
full and wide, Tamim leans into a lovely checked drive through the covers. Hit the gap and away it went past the right of mid-off.
taps it towards mid-off and sets off immediately. Good hustle from Tamim
back of a length on off stump, defended

beaten outside off! This is the one that goes away from Tamim, and it does so quite sharply after hitting a good length. The batsman was worried about the ball jagging back in and played down the wrong line
good length ball outside off, safely allowed through to the keeper
straying on the pads and Tamim's timing takes care of the rest. Gets forward and outside the line of the fuller ball and clips it between midwicket and mid-on
nudged away to the right of midwicket for a single
fuller delivery a shade outside off, Tamim taps it with the open face into the off side

oopsy, that's not quite the best shot to play as an opener. Hangs his bat out to a shortish delivery outside off. Should have either went for it hard, or shouldn't have played at all. Anamul though was stuck in the middle and is beaten
good length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot as it gets darker at the ground...

think he left that. Chatara's getting this new ball to jabber away. Pitches it just short of a good length and duck back in from outside off. Anamul gets across to cover his stumps and hides his bat behind his pad
fuller delivery on off stump, turned to short midwicket
good length ball outside off, Anamul confidently shoulders arms
neatly done! He barely hit it, but the ball ticks away to the square leg boundary. It was good length ball angled into him and Anamul has whipped it away

back of a length and it jags back in quite sharply at Tamim, who tries desperately to flick it away. Gets all sorts of cramped up as he leaps off his feet and races off to the other end as the ball dribbles away towards square leg
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
back of a length and outside off, punched towards short cover
shortish, but does not allow enough room for Anamul's cut shot. So he checks it and bunts it back at the bowler
short of a good length and angled in at off stump, clipped away to square leg

he's missed a straight ball! Caught in the crease against a fuller ball that was missing off and missing leg and hitting middle. Overestimates the angle into him and went for a flick, played all around it, and has to walk back
works it off his hips and helped away to the fine leg boundary. Didn't quite connect with bat, but handy runs nonetheless
pitches a little fuller, but he is still on leg stump. Tamim tries to flick, but wears it on the pads
back of a length on middle, Tamim tucks it to midwicket
very well left by Tamim. This was just short of a good length and outside off, with just a little bit of nip back in at the batsman, who makes sure not to poke
falls just short of midwicket! Chakabva was the man diving forward to try and make an impossible catch. It was a fuller ball on leg stump, tempting the flick that Tamim plays a little in the air.
good length ball on off stump, defended
shortish on middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket
climbing up on Imrul, but he keeps to his crease and nudges a shortish ball behind square leg
bangs it in again but it barely rises, Tamim goes for a pull but is a touch late. Gets the glove to deep fine leg
back of a length and outside off, pushed to cover
fuller delivery outside off, tapped towards mid-off
good length ball on middle and leg, defended
brings Tamim forward and gets the fuller ball to cut back in at Tamim, defended but not quite solidly
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to cover
back of a length and outside off, with a shade of away movement. Tamim rides it as he opens the face towards point
shortish and outside off, nudged away into the covers
goes for a bouncer, and the ump calls it one for the over. Tamim was set up for the pull but then allowed it to pass through to the keeper
good length ball on off stump, Tamim pushes forward to block. Gets an inside edge onto pad and that means the bowler's appeal is in vain
fuller delivery on off stump, defended
ventures forward to a good length ball outside off and slices it to point
back of a length and on off stump, Kayes is pinned to his crease and blocks
pushes him back in his crease with another shortish ball, Kayes pushes it to mid-off
good length ball on off stump, pushed into the covers. Umpire Gaffeney goes over to check the danger area again
fuller delivery on middle and leg, Kayes looks to pierce the covers with a punch. Only gets an inside edge to square leg
flash and a miss outside off. Seems the stagnant scorecard is getting into the batsmen here. Those slips would do well to be alert

back of a length on middle and off, Kayes drops it towards point, looks up at his partner to see if he was interested. That hesitation might have been dangerous but as fast as Vusi Sibanda had swooped down on the ball, he fails to get a good grip on it as he went for an underarm throw
goes short and Tamim swivels on his back foot and pulls to deep square leg. Wonderfully controlled
fuller delivery outside off, driven towards mid-off
good length ball angled across him, blocked to point
that's a top bouncer from Chatara. Gets it through at a good pace and there is loads of height on it as well. Tamim goes for a hook and is too late on his stroke. Soundly beaten
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers as he stood up tall behind it
shortish on middle and leg, Kayes works it away to deep square leg
he had backed away originally and Madziva looked to outwit him with a wide yorker, Tamim manages to reach out for it and slices it away to the point boundary
banged in short and it wanders down leg. Too high for Tamim to bother with
this one is a touch slower and outside off, Tamim was too quick with an the on-the-up drive and gets an inside edge
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed into the covers
back of a length on off stump, Tamim looks for a quick single after dabbing in front of point. But the Sibanda does not give him that luxury
fuller delivery on off stump, eased into the covers
walks down and across at the bowler, who shortens his length outside off. Kayes works it away through midwicket

he's picked out deep point! Pressure talks. This was a fuller delivery outside off, Tamim spotted an opportunity for a flay over point. Manages to do so, but forgets all about the man in the deep. Hami M continues to be the thorn in Bangladesh's side
good length ball outside off gets Mahmudullah forward to block, but Mire's scrambled-seam delivery moves away off the pitch and beats him
good length ball outside off, defended
back of a length in the off-stump channel, blocked

catch it, they cry, and Taylor has pulled off a stunner! Kayes goes for a flick and thinks he has nailed it, only to watch short midwicket move to his right, stick out a hand over his head and pluck it out of thin air
greets him with a bouncer first up, but Shakib has ducked under it
fuller delivery curling in at Shakib, which means he could go for that flick through mdiwicket. Seems to have gone at it too early and gets an outside edge through point
fuller delivery on off stump, brings Mahmudullah forward to block
checks his drive to mid-off as he realises he hadn't stretched far enough forward to a fuller delivery outside off
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with

shortish and outside off, Shakib rose to his full height and pulled his front leg up off the ground to get some leverage into the chop. But there was just not enough width to force the ball through the gap in the covers

that's the big wicket, and its come off a slower ball! It was full, it was wide, it was tempting and Shakib could not help himself. Leaned into a booming drive and realises he was at the ball way too early. Scoops it up for short cover.
gorgeous drive through extra cover! Top class stroke, especially off the first ball he faces. It was just a touch fuller, doesn't get the swing Mire was searching for and the batsman leans into it.

huge shout for caught behind, but the umpire hints that it might have come off the pad. He's right. This was a good length ball that cuts back in at Mushy, who was on that front foot again for a push to mid-off. Plays far outside the line as he doesn't account for the movement back in and is lucky
good length ball on off stump, defended

through the gap between slip and gully! Bangaldesh are looking seriously edgy out there, pun so intended. It was a fuller ball outside off, Mushy goes for an airy drive and manages to get his thick outside edge to run down to third man
good length ball outside off, safely left for the keeper
stroked through the covers, this time mid-off catches up with it. A bit too full and a bit too wide for Mushy not to capitalise
shortish and outside off, he rises up with it and blocks
back of a length and outside off, defended
full on off stump, Mushy waits on the ball on and clips it away to the midwicket boundary. His timing has been quite impressive so far
back of a length and outside off, left alone
too far outside off to interest the batsman, definitely gains the umpire's interest though
good length ball on off stump, defended
some curl away from the right-hander, but he had started it miles outside off stump. Easy decision for the ump again
back of a length and outside off, left alone
good length ball outside off, trudges forward to block
back of a length and outside off, slices towards cover
goes for a short ball outside off, Mahmudullah is quite happy not to flirt with it
sucked into playing outside off and is lucky not to nick off to the keeper. Zimbabwe on top, and they'd sure enjoy this drinks break
drifting down the leg and clips off his pads down to long leg for a single
goes for a hook, but he is hurried by the short ball. Gets a top edge that loops away to deep fine leg. Falls well short of the fielder rushing in
goes wide of the crease to increase the angle into the batsman, Mushy is solidly behind the good length ball
goes for another short ball, Mushy is content to ball up under it
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
that's a beaut! It's the kind of ball that Chatara hopes for with his natural angle in at the batsman. Perhaps just a bit too short there as he gets it to straighten outside off and beat Mushy's poke
fuller delivery outside off, driven to cover
top shot from Mahmudullah! Just a little wayward from Mire as he strays on the pads and the batsman punishes him with great authority. Flicked and it screams away to the square leg boundary
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers
beats the man at cover this time. Showing off his range here as he spots a fuller ball enticing him on the drive, stands quite still and unleashes a full swing of the arms to thread the gap
a touch slower as this was a fuller ball on middle, Mahmudullah clips to square leg
goes for the short one, Mahmudullah is content to duck under it
tossed up on off stump, Mushy tucks it to short fine leg
tossed up on off stump and it rips away past Mushy's flick. The Zimbabwe keeper is surprised by the amount of turn on offer and can't take it cleanly
square drive, and it's beaten point. Loads of loop outside off, but it was just a bit too wide and Mushy lunged forward to the pitch and sliced it away
leans forward and drives a flighted ball through to long-off
offers up a full toss that has been hammered through the covers. How much of a gamble is this from Zimbabwe?
flighted on middle, Mahmudullah closes the face and finds midwicket
goes back to punch a good length ball into the off side
goes back and clips a flatter delivery from off stump to mid-on
he never gets too much turn and Mahmudullah plays him like a medium pacer, rocks back and punches a good length ball into the covers
tossed up on off stump, defended off the front foot
shortish and outside off, Mahmudullah was set up for a cut but then checks it as he realises there is not enough room for him
worked away into the midwicket region
gets some extra bounce off the deck to worry Mushy. It was on a good length and outside off and Mushy was looking to defend on the front foot, until it leaps up to hit his gloves
lets the shortish ball come onto him and he rides it down to deep point
full on off stump, Mahmudullah whips it to short midwicket
good length ball on middle, kept out
fuller delivery teasing Mahmudullah outside off, he's happy to watch it cross by harmlessly to the keeper
slid down the leg side, Mahmudullah had been shaping to glance it fine, but then pulls his bat away

sooo close to short midwicket! The even evokes a reaction out of the normally stoic Zimbabwe coach, Mangongo! It was a slower ball on middle and the batsman opted to flick it away. He was way too early into the stroke and the ball lobs up and hung in the air for ages. Yet it wasn't quite long enough for Chatara at short midwicket to run to his left and try and do something about that
flighted outside off and it's been driven to cover
tossed up on middle, Mushy has swept it away quite powerfully top deep square leg
to the left of Hami M at deep backward square leg this time as Mushy set up for a scoop off a length delivery on off stump
goes back and slaps a shortish delivery outside off towards point
beautifully stroked down the ground as Mushy gets forward to a flighted ball and caresses it for mid-off to mop up
good length ball on the stumps, pushed into the covers
cracked away past a diving point, but deep third man keeps it to a single. Chiggy's getting a little more bounce than normal to keep the batsman from going too hard at the ball
good length ball on off stump, defended
strays on the pads and Mahmudullah has been quite good with the flick today. Manages to get it to the right of deep square leg and pick up a couple
too short and he has helped it away behind square leg. Front leg up off the ground, weight on the back foot and perfectly timed
slanted in at Mahmudullah who looks immensely capable against that line, tucked away to deep fine leg
short and wide and it's been hammered away over point. Too juicy to miss out on. Zimbabwe are not mustering the discipline that gave them four wickets so far
tossed up on off stump, defended
went for the lap sweep way too early, Kamungozi saw it and pulled his line outside off and hits Mahmudullah on pads, outside the line though
flighted on off stump, defended
stays inside the line and drills a flighted ball from middle and leg to deep cover
gets a bit of an outside edge as he lunges forward to block a good length ball on middle and off
takes it on the full and the slog sweep thuds into the square leg boundary. Loads of bottom hand on the stroke, and he hit the gap to the right of deep square leg as well
keeps it short and outside off, Mahmudullah chops it away to deep point
full on middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket
slower ball outside off, Mushy drives to mid-off
short and wide outside off, Mushy waited for it and cracks it away behind point. Lovely timing again
another slower ball outside off, Mushy had sized it up and stroked it to the left of cover
the slower ball goes awry outside off. Mahmudullah is happy to watch the ball through to the keeper and collect the extra
fuller delivery outside off, pushed into the covers
slower through the air and tossed up on middle, Mushy leans forward and scoops it to deep fine leg
brings him forward outside off and Mushy defends
drilled to long-off as he stays inside the line of a quicker, fuller delivery on leg stump
flighted on off stump, pushed into the covers
punched down to mid-off
flighted delivery on middle, kept out
good length ball outside off, defended
opens the face on a good length ball on off stump and finds point
pushed through the covers, lots of bottom hand to power the stroke through the infield. There isn't going to be any pace on the ball from Hami M anyway
slower than his usually slow deliveries, Mushy waits on it and clips to short fine leg
slaps a length ball away through the covers
runs a shortish ball outside off with an open face to third man and brings up the Bangladesh hundred
lovely shot! Runs at the legspinner as he makes room for himself and lifts a length ball over extra cover. One-bounce four
pulls his length back and gets a bit of turn as well. The quick kind, which means Mushy gets an outside edge off his front-foot defence
rocks back to slice a shortish ball from the off stump to point
turns a good length ball towards square leg, no single there though
flat-batted down the ground as Kamungozi offers a short ball outside off
flighted on middle, Mahmudullah defends into the vacant midwicket region
good length ball on off stump, defended
punches a back of a length ball down to long-on
shortish and outside off, chopped into the covers
full and outside off, tapped down the ground to long-on
fuller delivery outside off brings Mushy forward and exhibit a drive through the covers
full on middle, Mahmudullah clips it away to deep fine leg
full on off stump, driven to long-on
back of a length and outside off, Mahmudullah decides quite late not to go for a cut and checks his shot
beaten! Tosses it up on off stump and gets the ball to rip past the outside edge as Mahmudullah lunges forward to block
presses forward to block a fullish delivery on off stump
rocks back and cuts a shortish delivery to cover
slanted in at Mahmudullah, who uses his wrists to work the ball to short fine leg

back of a length on off stump, casually pushed to long-on to bring up his fifty, very important innings from Mushy and considering his underwhelming raise of the bat, he knows he needs to do a lot more here
pushed back at the bowler
slower ball on off stump, Mahmudullah gets a thick inside edge towards square leg as he jumped forward to block.
clipped to short midwicket as this is length on middle and leg
length ball, Mushy thought it was ripe for a slog sweep but there is just a little more bounce than he thought. Adjusts the stroke, which is why it doesn't carry to long-on
shortish and outside off, runs it down to deep third man
tossed up on middle, swept strongly to deep square leg
good length ball outside off, pushed down to mid-off
flighted on off stump, driven back at the bowler
tossed up outside off, defended with a bit of an open face
pushed through on middle and leg, Mushy uses the pace on it to work the ball behind square leg
launched to the square leg boundary! Vicious stroke from Mushfiqur as he went down on one knee and placed the ball well to the right of the man in the deep
good length ball outside off, Mushy taps the ball down to long-on and collects a couple
full and outside off, Mushy had premeditated a scoop and manages to find a couple to deep fine leg
worked away to deep fine leg again, this time off a more orthodox flick to a good length ball
short and wide outside off, slapped away into the covers. Chiggy dives and saves a certain boundary
fuller delivery outside off, driven to mid-off
fuller delivery slanted a bit too far outside off. Mushy knows this will be called a wide and is happy to leave

fuller delivery outside off, Mushy forgets about his footwork and hangs his bat out. Lucky to get an inside edge that evades the stumps and wanders away to deep fine leg. That's the hundred stand between these two
goes short and a shade outside off, Mahmudullah is content not to play
short midwicket leaps to his left, but Mahmudullah has placed the flick wide of him. Looks like he's feeling the pressure of a strike rate that's fluttering around the fifty mark
that had to be punished. It was short and wide and Mahmudullah could have picked his spot. He decides midwicket and pulls powerfully
seeks the wide yorker this time and Mahmudullah is able to slice it away to deep point
full on off stump, Mushy drills it down to long-on to retain strike, after drinks
drags his first ball, a googly, down short and slips it down leg to boot, Mushy opens up and blasts it away to deep square leg
length ball outside off, pushed down to long-off
another googly, but Mahmudullah has picked it and backed away to slice the ball past a diving point fielder. Amazing footwork to turn a pretty decent delivery into a boundary ball
awful delivery, and duly put away to the fine leg boundary. Think this was another wrong 'un from Maruma. It's only saving grace was how slow it was, so much that it almost beat Mahmudullah. Almost
flighted on middle, tucked to square leg
tossed up outside off, driven smartly into the covers
back of a length and outside off, slid off the open face to third man on the boundary
walks across to a fuller ball outside off and drives to mid-off
banged in short and Mahmudullah swivels on the back foot and pulls to deep square leg
offcutter outside off, Mushy rolls his wrists on top of it and turns it through midwicket
full toss on middle, Mahmudullah mistimes a swipe to deep midwcket. Throws his head back in disappointment as he runs through to the other end
goes short and Mushy has dragged it from above his head and swatted it through midwicket
a little slow and a little short, Mushy guides it to square leg
turn and bounce, as Mushy might himself say. It was a good length ball that rose sharply past the outside edge of the bat
tucked away to square leg
keeps to his crease and taps a shortish delivery through to long-off. Kamungozi rushes across and tried to get behind it, but was unable to
slid down the leg side, no need to bother with it
flighted on middle and leg, defended
feigns to be moving down leg and the bowler slides in a quicker, shorter ball outside off. Possibly what Mahmudullah was hoping for, but can't hit the gap with his cut
saw the slower and fuller ball early and whips it down to long-on for a single.
good length offcutter, tapped through the covers for a single
full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
goes for a bouncer a shade outside off, Mahmudullah ducks under it. Got a little too much height on it as well
short and wide with the offcutter, Mahmudullah bunts it off the bottom of the bat towards short cover
shortish and outside off, clipped away to deep square leg
finds deep square leg as he flicks a full toss on leg stump
good length ball with a bit of turn outside off, Mushy drops and runs into the covers
back of a length ball on leg stump, Mahmudullah pushes to long-on and gets to his fifty. A very hard working one

top-edge and cover takes a dolly! Mushy cannot believe he has got out so softly. It was slower through the air and pitched on off to tempt a slog sweep. There was just enough turn to make the batsman miscue the shot and Zimbabwe have finally broken through
looped up outside off to bring the new batsman forward to block, gets enough turn to beat the outside edge
fired in on middle and leg, defended
good length ball outside off, not bothered with
fullish on off stump, pushed down to long-on
full on off stump, defended stoutly
good length ball on middle, defended
fuller delivery a shade outside off, Mahmudullah was into a forward defensive too early and gets an inside edge
looks to take advantage of a length ball as he goes for a pull off the front foot. But the ball keeps low outside off and both the batsman and the wicketkeeper miss
short and wide, chopped to deep point
sits up for the pull and Mahmudullah has nailed it to deep square leg
gets off the mark with a vicious slog sweep to the square leg boundary
pulls his length back and gets enough turn to worry Sabbir. Defends with the open face and runs it to point
holes out at deep fine leg! He had to reach out a fair distance in front of him and only manages a top edge that lands in Chakabva's hands
flighted delivery on middle, Mahmudullah drives to long-off
nudged away off his pads to pick up a single behind square leg
cut him in half with a back of a length delivery that sneaks through bat and pad. The keeper doesn't stay low enough to gather it either
length on off stump and he has hoisted it straight up. It was the slower ball, and he had loaded up for the big shot far too early. Bat face turns in his hands and mid-on collects a simple catch
worked away of his hips to deep square leg
full and on the pads, Mashrafe nudges it through midwicket
good length ball on off stump, tapped to mid-on
short and wide, but Mahmudullah cannot capitalise. Hits it off the bottom of the bat to cover
run down to third man as he stays beside a good length ball outside off
short and outside off, he belts it away to the left of deep square leg
short and wide, Mashrafe lifts it over point for a single
worked away through the vacant midwicket region, which means the bowler himself has to run after it
tapped into the covers and both batsmen are in sync enough to sneak a quick single
full toss tailing in at Mahmudullah, who is only able to clip it to deep square leg
squeezed through point as Mire attempts the wide yorker outside off
good length ball outside off, eased into the covers for another quick single
tucked away past the man at short fine leg
slower ball holds in the pitch and spoils Mahmudullah's timing as he looks to flick it away through square leg
goes short and Mahmudullah rocks back to pull to deep square leg

appeal from the bowler, keeper was barely interested until he saw Chatara keep going on and on. It was a short ball that was angled in at Mashrafe who ducks below it. Didn't quite drop his wrists, but there was absolutely no contact. The umpire is actually quite bemused
backs away and tries to pull a short ball from outside off. Doesn't connect again
length on middle, Mashrafe clears his front leg and belts it through midwicket. Too powerfully hit, and there was no one in the deep as well
banged in outside off, Mashrafe stays inside the line of it and leaves comfortably
nudged down to long-on for a single
backs away outside leg and he follows with a yorker down the leg side. Keeper does well to leap across and save it
goes short this time and Mashrafe swivel pulls it quite fine. The man was inside the circle, which means that was a bit of a help yourself delivery
length on of stump, Mashrafe has hammered it off the middle and sends it soaring over deep midwicket. There was a man there, but had could not backpedal fast enough, or jump high enough
full and slanted into the pads, Mashrafe clips it to short fine leg
inside edge skewed away towards fine leg again

lands a yorker on off stump, but he seems to have overstepped. Very tight call, there may actually have been some part of the boot behind the line there. Single through the covers, but the trouble is that the next ball will be a free-hit.
gives length and Mahmudullah's efforts to slug it to the next city ends up as a top edge over the keeper's head
slower ball as he follows Mashrafe's movement away to the leg side. Beats the slog
change of pace keeps working for Chatara as he outwits Mashrafe's intended slogs over midwicket. Mahmudullah comes up to talk to his partner
backs away again and swats a shortish ball outside off to mid-off
full on middle and leg, Mahmudullah was looking to flick it away through midwicket. Was playing a little around a straight delivery and ends up with nothing for it
pushed into the covers where Taylor mops up
the yorker goes wrong down the leg side. Another inexplicable appeal from ZImbabwe, but there may as well have been miles of daylight between the flicking bat and bal
finds the yorker on middle and off, Mahmudullah pushes it through extra cover
makes the mistake of offering a length ball to Mashrafe who has deposited it into the stands behind square leg. This time the slower ball does not dupe the Bangladesh captain
full on off stump, Mashrafe's weight is on the back foot as he almost helicopters this down to long-off
nails the yorker on middle and leg and Mahmudullah is quite late to bring his bat down. Misses the stumps though
slower ball outside off, but Mashrafe has found his timing. Clears the front leg and laces a drive through the covers. Simply skims away off the turf.
pulled to deep square leg as he spots the slower, short ball early
length and outside off, Mahmudullah drags it to deep midwicket
hits the blockhole on middle and keeps it a single
another top yorker as he cramps the batsman up for any kind of room, which Mashrafe was looking for as he moved down leg

nicks off to the keeper and Zimbabwe will breathe a sigh of relief. it was a good length ball outside off and Mashrafe was looking to smoke it over cow corner. Ends up outside edging to Moor behind the stumps
full on off stump, swiped down to long-on
fullish on off stump, Mahmudullah lifts it through mid-off but doesn't get enough power behind it
back of a length on off stump, Rubel swings as best he can and gets a thick outside edge that lobs the keeper. He was desperately slow on the slog
swing and a miss to end the over
goes for the slower bouncer outside off, Mahmudullah pulls it down through midwicket
full and wide outside off, the batsman swipes it away to deep square leg for a couple
tapped into the covers for another quick single
low full toss outside off, mistimes a slog through midwicket
hip-high full toss which has been dispatched to deep fine leg for a couple, and that is how the innings ends

inn2.comm: starts with a wide down the leg side. Was looking for the full, straight one, I guess
back of a length outside off, blocked into the covers

full down the leg side once more, he can't quite connect with the flick, and it runs away towards fine leg. Looked like a tickle off the back leg. Mahmudullah chased back from slip and slipped near the outfield, looks to have sprained his leg slightly
shout for lbw as he pokes halfway forward at the incoming ball on the stumps. Big inside edge on that
full, on the pads, clipped away to the right of the short midwicket fielder and it rolls away to the boundary, losing no pace at all on the outfield
short and wide, and he slaps it away to the square cover boundary with a wave of his bat
back of a length outside off, doesn't quite come on as he looks to punch, and he gets an inside edge that runs away towards fine leg
back of a length on off and middle, shuffles across to tuck it away towards midwicket
length ball outside off, presses forward and blocks to mid-off
a little fuller now, nice line just outside off, and he gets a big stride forward to defend into the covers
back of a length on that fourth-stump line, blocked off the back foot towards mid-off
length ball outside off, punched to cover
a touch straighter now and he whips it away to the right of mid-on
length ball outside off, angling in towards off stump. Presses forward and defends into the covers
plays halfway forward at this length ball that's angling in towards off stump, and then it straightens away and beats his outside edge
back of a length outside off, punched firmly into the covers
fullish outside off, nice stride forward to defend towards cover
back of a length, a bit of width outside off, but he can't get that punch past cover
fullish slower ball outside off, and he's beaten as he pushes uncertainly away from his body
length ball on a fifth-stump line, left alone
too straight, on the pads, poor ball with fine leg inside the circle, and Sibanda clips it away crisply to the long leg boundary
back of a length outside off and he gets on his toes to punch to cover
length ball on a fourth-stump line, testing line, left alone
full outside off, and he presses forward to play a checked drive to cover
back of a length outside off, a bit of shape away, left alone
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended to short extra cover
shuffles down the pitch, works the ball from off stump towards fine leg with a roll of his wrists
ball! It's angling in towards off stump, back of a length, and it jags away off the pitch to square up Sibanda and beat his outside edge
short and wide and he has all the room in the world to flay that away to the square cover boundary
fuller now, angling in towards off stump, and again he gets it to move away late. Looks to defend from the crease and gets a thick outside edge towards backward point
full now, on off stump, defended into the covers off the front foot
length ball on middle and off, punched back to the bowler
full and wide, swinging away, and he looks to drive through the covers and ends up slicing it to the right of third man
length ball angling in towards middle stump, tucked away towards short midwicket
on the pads now and he works it away towards deep square leg
short and wide, but it's moving away and he has to reach out to try and cut and can't quite connect. No footwork there
full outside off, driven straight to cover
tossed up slow on middle stump, driven inside-out into the covers
length ball outside off, comes forward and steers it away towards short third man
angled in with that round-arm action, hung in the air a while, and it dipped and turned past Sibanda's outside edge
on the leg stump and he sweeps, gets down nice and low and hits it firmly to the right of deep backward square leg
arm-ball, angling in towards leg stump. Goes on the back foot and tucks it away into the on side
a bit of air outside off, stretches out and defends into the covers
back of a length on off stump, Masakadza blocks to short extra cover
looks to play the paddle-scoop from outside off. Wrong line and length to pick, and it bounces over at shoulder-height and carries on rising into the keeper's gloves
fullish on off stump, comes forward and punches to mid-off
length ball on off stump. Lets it come on and opens his bat face, steers it to backward point
overpitched outside off, driven powerfully but straight to mid-off
now he finds the gap. It was a better ball than the previous one, not quite overpitched, but he got right over it and presented a full face to punch it on the up between short extra cover and mid-off
tossed up nice and slow outside off. Sibanda stretches out, thinks about playing, elects to leave in the end
length ball outside off, presses forward and blocks into the off side
a little fuller, closer to off stump, defended into the off side
action replay of the previous ball
on the stumps, turned away towards deep midwicket off the back foot
short and wide, and that is a super shot, rocks back quickly and flat-bats it powerfully to the extra cover boundary
fullish on middle and off, straightens a touch. Looks to play from the crease and is opened up a touch as he defends into the covers
short ball, typical Rubel length, swatted down towards deep square leg
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, stands tall and punches to cover
another short ball, and he opens up and swings his arms freely across the line to pull it away to the midwicket boundary
back of a length on middle stump, bunted towards mid-on, looking for the quick single. Can't get it

given! The arm ball does the trick again, as he presses forward to defend and ends up playing down the wrong line. Kept on going with the angle, looked to hit his front pad pretty much right in front. Only doubt may have been because of the angle he's bowling from, so wide of the crease, but the umpire seemed quite sure
tossed up down the leg side, and Maruma sweeps it away towards long leg
tossed up full on off stump, defended towards silly point
speared in flat outside off, gets forward and blocks to silly point
a bit slower and it turns away sharply, extra bounce too. He pushes at the ball away from his body and is lucky not to edge it
turns away again, but this time it's a bit shorter, Maruma is on the back foot and he moves his bat inside the line to let it go
full outside off, presses forward to block into the covers
length ball angling in towards off stump. Stays in the crease and pokes it away into the covers
fullish on off stump, angling in. He looks to punch into the covers, checks his shot and gets an inside edge that rolls down to mid-off
on the pads now and he looks to work it away into the leg side, clips the outside of his pad and rolls away behind square on the leg side
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball on off stump. Defends from the crease, back towards the bowler
length ball outside off. Goes back and punches it with the turn into the covers
bowled him! That was the arm ball again and Masakadza had no clue. Plays a long way away from his body and presents a big gate for the ball to sneak through and crash into the stumps
nearly another wicket! Prods forward and pushes hard at the ball. Inside edge drops just short of the man at short leg
a touch shorter and he goes on the back foot to whip it away towards long on
loopy delivery, angling in, and he presses forward, looks to defend with a horribly angled bat. Ball turns away sharply and beats his bat
arm ball fired in flat. He goes on the back foot and lets it hit his thigh
back of a length, angling in towards middle and off. Gets on his toes to defend into the off side
back of a length outside off, straightens a touch and beats his outside edge as he pushes at it without moving his feet
shortish, angling in towards off stump, blocked into the off side
fuller now, along the same line, and he comes forward to defend back towards the bowler
angles this into the pads and he clips it away towards deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to short fine leg
tossed up, goes with the angle towards off stump, defended off the front foot
a bit slower now, turns away, he gets nicely forward to smother the turn
a touch shorter now, and he comes forward first before adjusting his feet to clear some room and slap it down the ground to long-off
on the stumps, defended into the on side
back of a length on middle and leg, defended towards short leg
full on middle and leg, flicked away to long leg
back of a length on off stump, defended with the angle into the on side
back of a length on middle stump, defended into the on side, gets on his toes to get on top of the bounce
back of a length outside off, can't beat point with that backfoot punch
length ball, a bit closer to off stump, blocked into the off side
a touch shorter now and he punches it to the right of point
fastish legbreak on leg stump, a touch short, and he goes back and across to tuck it away towards fine leg
tossed up outside off, driven ot sweeper cover
tossed up again, a bit of width. Maruma stays back and slaps it away to sweeper cover
quicker, on off stump, jams his bat down and works it away with the angle towards square leg

bowled him! It's the wrong 'un, and it's surprised Maruma, who went back and across, maybe to punch the ball through the covers. In the end, he brought his bat down hurriedly to try and squeeze it into the on side but it rips off the surface and sneaks between bat and body and clips the off bail. Lovely way to get your first ODI wicket
slower now, angling in towards off stump. Mire pokes hesitantly at it, with no idea which way it's going, and it turns past his outside edge and beats him
back of a length outside off, shuffles across to defend towards short cover
goes a bit wider of the crease, angles it in towards off stump. Taylor shuffles across and tucks it down towards short midwicket
a little fuller, on off stump. He stays on the back foot and works it away towards mid-on
now he brings him forward with a much fuller length and he looks to defend down the ground, and the angle forces him to play it off the inside half of the bat towards mid-on

uppish, he seemed a little frustrated there. Went for the big hit down the ground and the angle in causes his bat to turn in his hands, goes in the air, at catchable height, but well wide of mid-on, to the fielder's right
back of a length, and he taps the ball down into the ground on the off side, rolls towards the keeper and they sneak a risky-looking single
tossed up, driven to the left of long-off
what a delivery. That was angled in towards leg stump, and it turned away to beat his defensive prod, and bounced so much that Mushfiqur collected it at chest height
a bit fuller and he comes forward to drive towards long-off
sees a bit of air and he slogs it away wide of mid-on, this one's struck quite well, and it races away into the vacant boundary
loopy delivery outside off and he presses fully forward to defend
full on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
length ball outside off, waits on it and steers it away to the left of sweeper cover
length ball on off stump, gets forward to defend back towards the bowler
full, floaty slower ball outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full on off stump, goes for the slog and ends up playing a mistimed swipe to mid-on
length ball on off stump, presses forward to block it back towards the bowler
tossed up outside off, and he frees his arms and swings it down the ground, one bounce and into the boundary cushions at long-on
full outside off, a little quicker this time, and he drives it down to long-off
full-toss outside off, gives Mire enough room to drive with a full follow-through and beat long-off easily to his left
wide again, half-volley this time, driven to the extra-cover boundary. Beats the sweeper, who overruns the ball as he sprints to his right
full and flat on leg stump, defended to mid-on
another full-toss, and he can't get that drive past the fielder at cover
well, the umpire has miscounted. Anyway, he tosses up this extra ball outside off and Mire presses forward to defend
fullish on off stump, blocked into the covers
back of a length outside off, waits and plays a controlled punch to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, was there for the punch but it kept extremely low and sneaked under the bat and rolled down to the keeper
length ball, a bit of width outside off, and he opens his bat face and steers it away, past the diving keeper, to the third man boundary
length ball, angled in towards off and middle, defended back to the bowler
slower legcutter on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
loopy full-toss outside off, swept away powerfully to the square leg boundary
flat and quick outside leg stump, turns across the face of his defensive bat and hits him on the back pad. Appeals for lbw, but that definitely pitched outside the line
a bit more air now, on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
full, a bit of width outside off, driven powerfully to sweeper cover
back of a length, turns from leg to off, goes back and across and works it into the leg side
a bit of air again and Mire pounces, clearing his front leg and smashing it back down the ground, between the umpire and the non-striker
back of a length on off and middle, punched down the ground to long-on
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball outside off, goes for the flat-batted drive away from his body and he's beaten. No real footwork there
full on off stump, blocked to short extra cover
slower ball on off stump, pushed towards short midwicket from the crease
length ball on off stump, uses his wrists to clip it down the ground into the mid-on region
length ball on leg stump, goes on the back foot and defends to short midwicket
floated up towards off stump, defended to mid-off
a bit of turn now, down the leg side, and he clips it away to the left of short fine leg
on the pads now and he tucks it away towards deep square leg
back of a length outside off, steered towards deep point to bring up the 50 partnership
goes with the angle away from off stump. He comes forward and defends vigilantly, showing the full face
short ball, hurries onto the batsman and it's too close to him to pull. Doesn't middle it and it rolls down to short midwicket
back of a length outside off. Waits on it and slaps it down to third man
slower bouncer, and he's torn  between swaying and playing the ramp shot. In the end, he can't connect
slower ball outside off, punched to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, steered away to third man
shortish outside off, gets on his toes and pokes it away towards point
down the track now, and he clips it gently down the ground towards long-on, gives the batsmen enough time to run two, particularly since Tamim was a little slow getting to the ball at long-on
quicker and fuller, clipped away to the left of short fine leg
full, a bit of room outside off, and that gives him a lot of room to free his arms and smash that down the ground between the stumps and mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away defensively into the on side
back of a length on off stump. Lets it come on and dabs it down to short third man
length ball on middle stump, worked away off the front foot to the right of short midwicket
short, wide, and he stands tall and smacks it to the cover boundary
not as short as the previous one, a bit of width still, and he slashes it away towards third man
slower ball outside off, waits on it and dabs it down to third man
fullish, angling in towards off stump, he presents the full face to push that down to long-on
length ball outside off, a bit of extra bounce outside off to beat Mire. He was playing with an open face, trying to run that down to third man
full outside off, defended into the covers
back of a length, goes with the angle towards middle stump, goes back and punches it down the ground, into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
full on leg stump, clipped away to the left of short midwicket
low full-toss outside off, clipped down to long-on
shortish, and he swivels to pull it down to deep square leg
down the leg side now, tucked away to the left of short fine leg
full, angling in towards off and middle. He keeps his front pad out of the way and defends down the ground
tossed up outside off, presses forward to block into the off side
full on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
a little slower, angled in towards leg stump, defended with the full face of the bat
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended off the front foot. His bat came down at an angle there
big appeal for lbw as he slips in the arm ball. Not given. He was playing for the turn, outside the line, and that looked quite close. Need to see a replay there.

dropped! Wasn't the best ball, a long-hop, really, and he pulled it in the air and the man at deep backward square leg had come in off the rope, leaped in the air, got both hands to it, but couldn't grab on
back of a length, punched towards point for a single
full, worked away towards short fine leg
full on leg stump, defended back to the bowler
a bit of air now and Mire loves that, swings cleanly through the line and launches it over the long-on boundary. First six of the innings.
tossed up outside off, and that is a good shot from Taylor. Reaches out and shovels it powerfully over the leg side, down to the squarish midwicket boundary
full outside off, looks for another slog and gets an inside edge that runs down to short fine leg
beauty. That was angled in towards off stump, on a good length, and it turned away sharply to beat his defensively thrust bat
even better this time, angles this in towards middle and leg, and rips it across the face of the bat with turn and bounce
a bit fuller and he presses forward to defend into the on side
loopy half-volley outside off, driven with a lot of bottom hand to long-off
back of a length on off stump, punched to the right of point
shortish, angling into the body, and he goes back and across to tuck it into the leg side
short ball, and it's swatted down to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short ball, and he swivels on his toes and pulls it over the midwicket boundary, effortlessly, to bring up a splendid half-century. It's also the century partnership
short and wide, it was there to be hit, but he didn't move his feet and couldn't connect with that slash
starts with a ball angled down the leg side and he sweeps it away towards short fine leg
googly, comes in sharply as he goes on the back foot, and he has to jam his bat down in a hurry to squirt that away towards square leg
short, a bit of width, chopped towards cover
and he's broken the partnership. Tossed it up, and he went for the big drive and maybe didn't quite get to the pitch, ends up hitting it at chest height, straight to Mahmudullah at cover
lots of turn away from off stump. Chakabva lets it go
full outside off, comes forward and pokes it away towards point
short, some width outside off, and he opens his bat face to steer that to the left of point, and times it well enough to beat third man sprinting like mad and diving to his right
back of a length outside off, dabbed with soft hands towards point
back of a length on off stump, looks to work it away into the leg side with the angle, closes his bat face too early and gets a leading edge towards mid off
bouncer, and he ducks hurriedly under the ball

gone! It's another bouncer, outside off this time, and he has the width to try and ramp that behind the wicket, but he doesn't really get that much bat on it, and ends up hitting it straight to the keeper
full on off stump, and he comes forward and works it away towards deep square leg
length ball, cuts in from outside off and bounces a bit. Looks to work it leg side but it beats him and hits him on the thigh
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to backward point
slower ball, angled in towards off stump, defended off the back foot towards the bowler
back of a length, angling in sharply towards middle stump. He looks to punch into the off side and ends up chopping it down into the pitch
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
short and wide, and he cuts it powerfully into the ground and it bounces over the leaping point fielder
full, angling in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball, angling in again. He stays inside the line and bunts that down towards point
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, makes room and steers it away into the deep point region
back of a length, angling in sharply towards middle stump, jams his bat down to defend into the on side
back of a length outside off, keeps a bit low. Looks to punch through cover, chops it down back towards the bowler
fullish outside off, comes forward and dabs it to point
full outside off, it was the slower ball. Looked to drive through cover, went too early at it, and dragged it uppishly towards mid-on
length ball outside off, angling in, pushed down the ground with soft hands, towards mid-on
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away towards point
slower ball outside off. Comes forward, looks to push into the covers, has to wait a long time and can only drop it down into the pitch
full on off stump, driven to long-off
short now, turns away and gives him some width, slaps it away to sweeper cover
down the track now, clips iut away into the leg side and short midwicket moves quickly to his right to cut it off
goes on the back foot and it goes with the angle, nearly sneaks under his bat as he looks to punch and he inside edges into the pitch
goes for the sweep and it turns and beats him and hits him on the back thigh. Appeal for lbw, he was in front of off and middle, but it was probably too high
full now, on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers
slower ball outside off and he goes for the big hit, away from his body. Wasn't full enough to drive anyway, and he miscues it high in the air, and spoons a simple catch to mid-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump, tucked away to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot towards point
length ball outside off, comes forward and punches to mid-off
short ball outside off, doesn't quite come on as he looks to cut, and he bottom-edges it, rolls down to the keeper
short ball outside off, moving away from him all the time. Reaches out to slap it, and doesn't connect. No footwork at all
back of a length, angling in from outside off, chopped down to point
again it's short and wide, and again he reaches out without moving his feet, and again he's beaten
back of a length outside off. Left alone
back of a length outside off, this time he manages to steer it away to third man
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the covers
slower ball on off stump, bunted down towards mid-on for the quick single
full outside off, closes his face a little early on the drive, plays it down to long-on
back of a length outside off, came in off the pitch, he can only block it back to the bowler
slower ball outside off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, looks to steer it past point but he dives to his right and keeps it down to a single
back of a length outside off, dabbed away towards point
short, rising ball outside off, and it bounces over his top edge as he aims a flat-footed cut at it
again. That was there to cut, but he's never going to connect with footwork like that
slower ball on the pads and he lets it come on and clips it away towards deep square leg
back of a length outside off, and he gets on his toes to dab it away towards point
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
full, angled in towards off stump, steered away towards point
flat. angled in towards middle stump, defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, and he aims a cut at it and can't connect
fuller now, driven down to long-off
long-hop outside off, a rare bad one from Shakib, and he swivels and pulls it away to the midwicket boundary
angled in towards leg stump and he goes on the back foot, makes room, and pushes it down the ground to long-on
down the leg side, shuffles across his stumps, looking for the wide, not given
length ball outside off, goes for the big slog over midwicket, slices it in the air down to third man
length ball outside off, slashed away to third man
back of a length outside off, throws his bat at it, gets a thick outside edge that runs away very fine to the third man boundary
shortish on off stump, he shuffles across and tucks it away to the left of short fine leg
full, down the leg side, and this time it was just wide enough for the umpire to signal wide
length ball outside off, driven into the covers
very full outside off, looks to squeeze it away past point, the ball sneaks under his bat
full outside off, goes for the drive, can't time it very well, rolls back to the bowler
again, very full outside off, in the blockhole, jabbed away into the covers
tossed up on off stump, slogged away down to long-on
slides this down the leg side, and he can't connect with the sweep. Again, wide not given
in the blockhole on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
length ball outside off, looks to shuffle across and scoop over short fine leg. Can't quite middle it, and it bounces down to the fielder
shortish, doesn't rise too much as he goes for the pull. Off his thigh into the off side
makes room to hit over the off side, ends up going too far away from the length ball outside off. Reaches across to hit it over cover, ends up slicing a high catch to point
full on off, and he makes room and flat-bats it powerfully to the cover boundary
slower ball outside off, slapped to point
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and blocks it towards point

gone! Pushed it towards point and went for the quick single. Hit it straight to the fielder but the desire to bring Moor on strike was a more pressing factor than the feasibility of the single. Throw came in, keeper whipped the bails off, and Moor was nowhere near his crease
tossed up outside off, swiped towards deep midwicket
skips down the track and he shortens his length a bit, ends up blocking in an ungainly way, back to the bowler
loopy delivery wide outside off. Goes for the slog over the leg side, can't connect
back of a length outside off, dabbed towards point
full on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
short ball, goes for the pull, can't connect
slower bouncer outside off. Makes room first, then tries to reach over and uppercut, can't connect again
down the track now, he bowls the slower one outside off, and he clubs it down to long-on
full on middle stump. Makes room and drives straight to mid-off
down the track, he follows him with the short ball, and he semi-fends, semi-hooks, and mostly periscopes it away to the long-leg boundary
waist-high full-toss on off stump, slapped to mid-off
slower ball outside off. He makes room initially to swipe over the leg side, and then it turns away from off stump and he just looks at the ball bewildered as it rolls away to the keeper
full on off stump, swiped away to deep square leg
down the track, it's the slower ball outside off. Meets it on the full and slaps it to cover
down the track, it's another slower ball, and he slogs and misses
another slower ball outside off, another slog and miss
slower ball on leg stump, and Chatara finishes with a six. Simply whips it away, times that so well that it disappears over the boundary to the right of the deep midwicket fielder
